page.title: 02COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Braceby and Sapperton both have a Post Office{letter box. Mail}is delivered to each house six days a week (not Sundays) by van from Sleaford. A collection of outgoing mail is made from the boxes at the same time. Both villages have a{public telephone kiosk. These have been considered un- economic by British Telecom but residents have campaigned to retain them for people who do not have a {private telephone}and especially for use in emergencies both by residents and passers-by. So, at present, they are still in use but the minimum charge for a call has now risen to ten pence. Only one house in Braceby is without a telephone. The farms use {radio}transmission to pass messages to the men working in the fields from the farmhouse. Three businesses based here use{micro computers.
